abstract.p: Spain's Telefonica SA is in talks to purchase Motorola's stake in several Mexican mobile phone companies; it will be Teleonica's first move into Mexico; companies are Movitel, Portatel, Cedetel, Baja Celular and Norcel; photo (S)

block.p: Spain's telephone company, Telefonica S.A., is in talks to purchase Motorola's stake in several Mexican mobile phone companies. It would be Telefonica's first move into Mexico. Telefonica said a subsidiary, Telefonica Moviles, would acquire the Motorola shares and that a final agreement was expected within the next two weeks. No price for the shares was disclosed by Telefonica, but Spanish media reports said that the purchase would be worth about $2.6 billion and the companies involved were Movitel, Portatel, Cedetel, Baja Celular and Norcel. The transaction would be the first since Cesar Alierta, above, took over as chairman and Fernando Abril-Martorell as chief executive after Juan Villalonga resigned in July. The deal would give Telefonica Moviles about 1.3 million new cell phone customers.

Spain's telephone company, Telefonica S.A., is in talks to purchase Motorola's stake in several Mexican mobile phone companies. It would be Telefonica's first move into Mexico. Telefonica said a subsidiary, Telefonica Moviles, would acquire the Motorola shares and that a final agreement was expected within the next two weeks. No price for the shares was disclosed by Telefonica, but Spanish media reports said that the purchase would be worth about $2.6 billion and the companies involved were Movitel, Portatel, Cedetel, Baja Celular and Norcel. The transaction would be the first since Cesar Alierta, above, took over as chairman and Fernando Abril-Martorell as chief executive after Juan Villalonga resigned in July. The deal would give Telefonica Moviles about 1.3 million new cell phone customers.
